remarks.para: ASP.NET health monitoring allows production and operations staff to manage deployed Web applications. The namespace contains the health-event types responsible for packaging application health-status data and the provider types responsible for processing this data. It also contains supporting types that help during the management of health events.

This interface allows enabling or disabling the firing of a specific event. This is especially useful when you implement your own custom event and want to control the rate at which it is sent to the related provider for processing.

block.para: This interface does not control how often the event is raised. It only controls how often the event information is sent to the provider for processing.

summary.para: Evaluates whether an event should be sent to the related provider for processing.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool CanFire (System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent raised_event, System.Web.Management.RuleFiringRecord record);

remarks.para: If the custom event evaluator returns true, the event is raised and then processed by the associated provider.

summary.para: Evaluates whether an event should be raised.

returns.para: true if the event should be raised; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The containing information about the event.
